intro: Schefflerodendron usambarense, commonly known as the Usambara schefflera, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Eastern Arc Mountains of Tanzania. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 50 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
